subject: Psychology
title: The Amygdala as Alarm System
description: Learn The Amygdala as Alarm System in one minute.

hook.text: A patient with a damaged amygdala couldn't feel fear. She approached dangerous animals without flinching.

buildup.text: The amygdala is an almond-shaped structure that processes threats and assigns emotional significance.

discovery.text: It receives sensory input before the cortex and can trigger a fear response in milliseconds.

twist.text: The amygdala doesn't just process fear. It tags all emotionally important events for stronger memory encoding.

climax.text: It's less an alarm and more an importance detector ‚Äî flagging what matters for survival and memory.

punchline.text: The amygdala decides what matters before you even know it.

quiz.question: What is the primary function of the amygdala?
